title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Cavaliers Fall Short in Historic Wilkins Showdown**

CLEVELAND — On a night where defense reigned supreme, a singular, breathtaking offensive force took center stage. The Washington Bullets escaped with an 85-81 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers on the back of a legendary, 45-point explosion from Dominique Wilkins, turning a gritty contest into a personal showcase.

From the opening tip, this was the Dominique Wilkins show. The “Human Highlight Film” turned back the clock, defying age and the Cavaliers’ defense with a breathtaking array of dunks, turnarounds, and clutch jumpers. He single-handedly shouldered the Bullets’ offensive load, accounting for over half of his team’s total points. His 45 points were not just a game-high; they were a statement.

The Cavaliers, led by a formidable 21-point, 19-rebound near double-double from Tyrone Hill and a solid 18-point contribution from Bobby Phills, fought valiantly. They traded blows with the Bullets throughout a physical, low-scoring affair, but they had no answer for Wilkins’ singular brilliance. Every time Cleveland threatened to seize momentum, Wilkins responded with another basket, silencing the home crowd.

In the game’s final, frantic minutes, with the outcome hanging in the balance, it was Wilkins who iced the victory. His final points, likely from the free-throw line where he went a perfect 7-for-7, sealed the hard-fought win. While Gheorghe Muresan provided crucial interior presence with 17 rebounds, this night belonged unequivocally to one man.

The final score will show a team victory for the Bullets, but the story written on the court was a historic solo performance by Dominique Wilkins, a timeless display of scoring prowess that Cleveland simply could not overcome.
